issue.title: [C++] Provide a (FileSystem, path) pair to locate files across filesystems
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9909](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9909). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8101#discussion_r482921953

Paths are sufficient to locate files within a known filesystem, but APIs (for example datasets) do not always have a single known filesystem and in such contexts a (fs, path) pair would be useful.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9909?focusedCommentId=17286001) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
It seems this was actually done (the `FileLocator` struct) in ARROW-9868.
